Class Soldier

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimulationObject
      • Soldier
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Commando, RegularSoldier, Sniper

    public abstract class Soldier
extends SimulationObject
    Abstract soldier class
    Author:
    koray

      Soldier(java.lang.String name, Position position, SoldierType soldierType, double collisionRange, double shootingRange, double speed)

      • Soldier

        public Soldier(java.lang.String name,
               Position position,
               SoldierType soldierType,
               double collisionRange,
               double shootingRange,
               double speed)
        Creates abstract soldier with given parameters Sets default state to SEARCHING
        Parameters:
        name - name of the soldier
        position - position of the soldier
        soldierType - type of the soldier
        collisionRange - collision range of the soldier
        shootingRange - shooting range of the soldier
        speed - speed of the soldier

      • aimingSoldierStep

        public void aimingSoldierStep(SimulationController controller)
        Step calculation for aiming soldier Since both regular soldier and sniper do the same thing, This function is moved to the abstract soldier class. Since the commando does not aim, this function is overridden by an empty method in the commando
        Parameters:
        controller - simulation controller
